ppm_java.backend

Class TController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ppm_java.backend.TController

  • public final class TController
extends java.lang.Object
    Central application point. Contains the API to set up a ppm-java signal processing network and to run it. Note that every object we create is stored in the global registry and identifiable by a unique ID (opaque handle). This simplifies the syntax for the setup of the signal network enormously.
    Author:
    Peter Hoppe
    See Also:
    The service class that contains the signal processing network setup.

      • Create_AudioContext

        public static void Create_AudioContext(java.lang.String id)
        Creates the audio driver.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique ID of the audio driver.

      • Create_Connection_Data

        public static void Create_Connection_Data(java.lang.String idFromPort,
                                          java.lang.String idToPort)
        Creates a connection between two compatible endpoints. The following connections are possible:
        From port type To port type
        VAudioPort_Output_Samples VAudioPort_Input_Samples
        VAudioPort_Output_Chunks_NeedsBuffer VAudioPort_Input_Chunks_Buffered
        VAudioPort_Output_Chunks_NoBuffer VAudioPort_Input_Chunks_Unbuffered
        Parameters:
        idFromPort - Unique ID of the source port.
        idToPort - Unique ID of the target port.

      • Create_Connection_Events

        public static void Create_Connection_Events(java.lang.String idSource,
                                            java.lang.String idRecipient)
        Subscribes an IEvented object (subscriber) to receive events from another IEvented (subscribed). The subscriber will receive all events emitted by the subscribed and needs to implement its own event filtering to listen to the events it's interested in.
        Parameters:
        idSource - Unique ID, subscribed.
        idRecipient - Unique ID, subscriber.

      • Create_StartListEntry

        public static void Create_StartListEntry(java.lang.String idModuleToStart)
        Creates an entry in the application's start list. When the network starts, this entry will start the corresponding module. Modules will be started in the order of the start list.
        Parameters:
        idModuleToStart - ID of the module to start.

      • Create_StopListEntry

        public static void Create_StopListEntry(java.lang.String idModuleToStop)
        Creates an entry in the application's stop list. When the network terminates, this entry will stop the corresponding module. Modules will be stopped in the order of the stop list.
        Parameters:
        idModuleToStart - ID of the module to stop.

      • PostEvent

        public static void PostEvent(int e,
                             java.lang.String idSource)
        Event API: Module idSource posts an event. Will be distributed to subscribers.
        Parameters:
        e - Event posted.
        idSource - ID of the module posting the event.

      • PostEvent

        public static void PostEvent(int e,
                             int arg0,
                             java.lang.String idSource)
        Event API: Module idSource posts an event. Will be distributed to subscribers. Carries an extra argument as in-band data. Useful if the listener needs some more qualifying information with the event.
        Parameters:
        e - Event posted.
        idSource - ID of the module posting the event.
        arg0 - The in-band data.
        See Also:
        IEvented

      • PostEvent

        public static void PostEvent(int e,
                             long arg0,
                             java.lang.String idSource)
        Event API: Module idSource posts an event. Will be distributed to subscribers. Carries an extra argument as in-band data. Useful if the listener needs some more qualifying information with the event.
        Parameters:
        e - Event posted.
        idSource - ID of the module posting the event.
        arg0 - The in-band data.
        See Also:
        IEvented
